title: Welcome & Course Introduction
objectives: Ask strangers for help in English with confidence
Balance politeness and directness without sounding rude
Blend short Hindi touches for comfort
Feel calmer when stuck in unfamiliar places

activities.text: Namaste and Welcome! Aaj hum seekhenge help maangna, bina awkward feel kiye. Iss lesson ke end mein, aap confidently bol paoge “Excuse me…” bina dar, bina tension ke!

activities.caption: Imagine: Aap ek bade station mein ho, har koi busy dikh raha hai —aur aap bahar jane ka rasta dhoond rahe ho. Chahein aap thoda lost feel karo, par hum politely strangers se rasta puch sakte hain!

activities.text: Humara main goal: short, polite phrases use karna, jo logon se quick help dilaye. Fancy grammar chhod do — tone aur smile is enough!

vocabItems.meaning: Polite phrase to get attention, like ‘Maaf kijiye’ but English version.
When you can’t find your way (e.g., 'Mujhe raasta nahi pata').
To show or direct someone to a place or solution.

activities.text: Yeh words yaad kar lo: ‘Excuse me’ (attention), ‘lost’ (confusion), and ‘guide’ (show way). Tone is must! Ab ek fill-in-the-blank try karein?

activities.sentence: Excuse me, main thoda ______ hoon. Could you guide me, please?
hints: English clue: Means you can’t find your way

feedback.correctText: Perfect! ‘Lost’ bolne se log samajh jaayenge aapko direction chahiye!
feedback.wrongText: Close! Correct word is ‘lost’—yaad rakho, means no idea about the route.

activities.text: Dekha na, small & polite requests kitne kaam aate hain. Ab hum ek aur short question try karte hain!

activities.sentence: Excuse me, can you _____ (help/ignore) me find the ticket counter?
hints: Polite request ke liye help word best hai
Opposite is ignore—wo to hum chaahte hi nahi!

feedback.correctText: Yes! ‘Help’ is correct. Polite tareeke se request karo.
feedback.wrongText: Nope—‘ignore’ kyun hoga? Humein to unki madad chahiye.

activities.text: Dekha na, small & polite requests kitne kaam aate hain. Ab hum dialogue chat par chalte hain!

activities.contextTitle: Aap apke dost se help maang rahe ho station par

messages.text: Hey, main station par hoon par exit nahi mil raha. Kya tum meri help kar sakte ho?
Of course! Just check the station map or politely ask a staff member.
Thanks! Bina hesitation ke, ‘Excuse me…’ se start karta hoon!

activities.visualDesignHint: Glowing chat bubble style for an immersive experience
activities.learningTakeaway: Friendly chat can remind you: politely approach staff with short lines & calm tone.

activities.text: Yaad rakho, real life conversation me politeness hi sabse zyada matter karta hai! Let’s fix a short error next.

activities.instruction: Spot the rude or inappropriate phrase:
activities.originalSentence: I need help, come here now!
activities.explanation: Saying 'now!' rudely sounds demanding. Always request politely, like 'Could you please help me?' instead of shouting.

activities.text: Awesome. Politeness ke saath thoda correct order of approach se bahut help milti hai!

activities.sentence: I feel ______ (nervous/confident) asking for help from strangers.
hints: Beginner stage pe aap confident kam, nervous zyada hotey ho

feedback.correctText: Yes, 'nervous' is normal. But polite approach se confidence aayega!
feedback.wrongText: Hmm, 'confident' is not typical for newbies. Sahi answer: nervous.

activities.text: Koi problem nahi, nervous feel karna normal hai. Practice se sab theek hoga!

activities.question: What is your current biggest hesitation in public help-seeking?
options: Language barrier—Hindi se English mein pahle translate karna aur phir bolna

dynamicFeedback.0: Shy? Smile + short line helps break ice.
dynamicFeedback.1: Switch is okay—thoda Hinglish chalti hai!
dynamicFeedback.2: Keep phrases from this lesson as cheat sheet!
dynamicFeedback.3: We’ll keep practicing with more examples!

activities.text: Chalo! Let’s do a short reorder. Keep it super polite!
Dekho, pehle 'Could you', phir 'please guide me?'— This flow is easy, polite. Let’s see a mini story now!

scenes.text: Scenario: Aap ek huge Indian wedding mein ho, sab dance kar rahe hain and You want to ask someone to find the food counter politely!
Instead of ‘Bhai, buffet kahan hai?!’ say: ‘Excuse me, main thoda lost hoon. Could you please guide me to the food area?’
Lesson moral: Station ho ya wedding, polite approach + short request = help guaranteed!

activities.text: Dekha—consistent polite formula har jagah kaam aata hai. Next, ek word-builder try karein?

activities.instruction: Drag letters to form the word ‘HELP’. Basic but crucial word for seeking assistance!

activities.text: Bas yaad rakho: Tone + 'HELP' request = you’ll do fine in tricky spots. One final quiz!

activities.question: Which line sounds politely direct, bina over-apology?
options: Hey, quickly tell me where to go now!
Excuse me, I’m a bit lost—could you show me the exit?
Bhai, exit ka raasta bata do, yaar.
hints: Look for short apology + direct request + polite tone.
activities.encouragementOnFail: No big deal, re-check polite vs. rude lines!

activities.prompt: Verbal practice: ‘Excuse me, could you help me find [Your Place]? Thanks!’ Ab loud bolke dekh lo!

activities.title: Lesson Recap
activities.body:
1) ‘Excuse me…’ se start karo
2) Bol do ‘I’m a bit lost’ or ‘Need help’
3) Tone & courtesy sabse important hota hai
4) Thoda Hindi mix is okay—but remain polite

activities.text: Congratulations! Aap ab har situation me help maang sakte ho politely bina awkward hue. Keep going!

activities.title: Next: Greetings & Goodbyes
activities.description: Aapka pehla ‘Hello’ aur aakhri ‘Bye’ hi logon ke dimaag mein aapki image banaata hai. Ready to master that next?

activities.title: Help Seeker Hero!
activities.description: Lesson 1 done—ab aap politely help maang sakte ho, tension-free. Keep practicing aur milte hain next lesson mein!
